dviola: you can update your PR and the the revert approach
the revert option is probably more sane since the wayland codepath was added for Qt::WindowStaysOnTopHint (which won't work) anyway
hebasto: will do!
kk

killall -KILL #bitcoin-core-dev

sipa are you threatening me

I understand the frustration when it comes to wayland restrictiveness, but that's kind of the point

#bitcoin-core-dev Meeting: abubakarsadiq achow101 _aj_ ajonas b10c brunoerg cfields darosior dergoegge dzxzg eugenesiegel fanquake fjahr furszy gleb glozow hebasto hodlinator instagibbs janb84 jarolrod jonatack josibake kanzure kevkevin laanwj LarryRuane lightlike l0rinc luke-jr maflcko marcofleon maxedw Murch pinheadmz provoostenator ryanofsky sdaftuar S3RK stickies-v sipa sr_gi tdb3 theStack TheCharlatan vasild willcl-ark

There are no pre-proposed meeting topics this week. Any last minute ones to add?
hi
hi
#topic Kernel WG Update (TheCharlatan)
Got some first ACKs on #30595 this week, looking for some more eyeballs.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30595 | kernel: Introduce C header API by TheCharlatan · Pull Request #30595 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
that's all
hi
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
#33157 got merged, thanks for all the reviews!
sipa: Error: That URL raised <Connection timed out.>
#33157 got merged, i said
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33157 | cluster mempool: control/optimize TxGraph memory usage by sipa · Pull Request #33157 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
that's pretty much all of txgraph in, apart from a few small things which won't block anything
the focus is now #33629, which is a rebased, and reduced version of the older 28676 cluster mempool PR
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33629 | Cluster mempool by sdaftuar · Pull Request #33629 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
hi
follow-ups have been split off in #33591
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33591 | Cluster mempool followups by sdaftuar · Pull Request #33591 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
Two Weeks(tm)
woohoo
nice!
hi
sdaftuar and I have also been working on some more simulations with historical and less historical data, to do final benchmarks of performance and optimality
hi
but i think we're in a really good spot now
sipa this would effect cluster sizes, and number of conflicting clusters, potentially?
but otherwise stay similar approach?
instagibbs: "this" being what?
> to do final benchmarks of performance and optimality
responding to these benchmarks
are their plans to have an updated bip to 125 indicating the new RBF rules?
instagibbs: i think (especially with the prospect of SFL) we'll stick to 64 as max cluster tx count, unless we discover something very unexpected
abubakarsadiq: i don't think "non-actionable" policies ought to be BIPs
in the sense that they don't really require anyone to be aware of them
unlike say TRUC, which aims to provide a specific interface that user software can make use of
Okay, I saw the replacement docs have been updated so that is okay then
speaking of SFL, i'm about to push a much updated version of #32545
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32545 | Replace cluster linearization algorithm with SFL by sipa · Pull Request #32545 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
but it's largely orthogonal to the actual cluster mempool PRs
heh. after cluster mempool, we implement less than half of BIP 125
glozow: it may be worth updating BIP 125 with some color about relevance
yep
if the authors/champions agree
that's it for me
#topic MuSig2 WG Update (achow101)
it's merged!?
#29675 was merged!
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29675 | wallet: Be able to receive and spend inputs involving MuSig2 aggregate keys by achow101 · Pull Request #29675 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
woohoo
musig to my ears!
fjahr opened a followups pr: #33636
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/33636 | wallet: Expand MuSig test coverage and follow-ups by fjahr · Pull Request #33636 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
but I think this working group is done :D
Any other topics to discuss this week?
#endmeeting

hebasto, pablomartin4btc: I think this "bringToFront" function should go away, bitcoin core shouldn't have to deal with window management
I mean, it's not bitcoin core's job to deal with this
it's just going to add pointless bugs like the ones we've been trying to fix
I understand not opening duplicated transaction details (so that the user doesn't get confused) but that sounds like a separate issue
dviola: feel free to open a pr :)
will look into it
hebasto: I think your call to revert was good, so for now I think that's ok
will look into the other things later, like the duplicated transaction stuff
window managers already have the option to set rules, so bitcoin core trying to do that job is just going to make things more complicated
I think
or let's just keep the function small (if it's going to stay)
bringToFront also assumes I use a floating window manager (I'm using tiling)
most people use floating, so it makes sense in a way

hebasto, pablomartin4btc: there is apparently a requestActivate() function in Qt which should use xdg-activation, AFAIK this should work everywhere and should work for the "bring focus to window" thing
I'm planning on experimenting with it and refactor that bringToFront
you shouldn't have to do it for wayland/xcb separately, Qt should already know how to handle it all
not sure I have the time to do it though, but that's a good place to look into
I think

hebasto, pablomartin4btc: I think this "bringToFront" function should go away, bitcoin core shouldn't have to deal with window management
